{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3543040,"name":"Rishi Desai","username":"rdesai14","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/3ab097/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-27T23:49:25.689Z","cooked":"

Hey quick question we had pathplanner drive to pose working on our old robot but with our current code. We switched robots to this year robot with the same code and the robot drives extremely slow and inaccurately. Any ideas why? We switched the tuner constants as well. Here’s our code

github.com

GitHub - 7451AvengerRobotics/FRC2025

Contribute to 7451AvengerRobotics/FRC2025 development by creating an account on GitHub.

@mjansen4857

Anyone?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2025-02-28T01:20:38.165Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":40,"reads":98,"readers_count":97,"score":219.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":493553,"topic_slug":"swerve-pathfind-to-pose","display_username":"Rishi Desai","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/7451AvengerRobotics/FRC2025","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"GitHub - 7451AvengerRobotics/FRC2025","clicks":7}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57090,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Head Programming for 7451"},"post_url":"/t/swerve-pathfind-to-pose/493553/1","custom_user_title":"Head Programming for 7451","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3543124,"name":"Vihaan C","username":"VihaanC","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/vihaanc/{size}/237555_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-28T02:01:15.904Z","cooked":"

Just doing a quick skim, I believe you have to set the type of path finding in robotInit instead of your drive.java file.

github.com

7451AvengerRobotics/FRC2025/blob/c90b63e521dc1d459b5a469e3a217bd55ee8f8b1/src/main/java/frc/robot/subsystems/Swerve/Drive.java#L135


      
    
          
  1. AutoBuilder.configure(
    2. 
          
  2.     this::getPose,
    3. 
          
  3.     this::setPose,
    4. 
          
  4.     this::getChassisSpeeds,
    5. 
          
  5.     this::runVelocity,
    6. 
          
  6.     new PPHolonomicDriveController(
    7. 
          
  7.         new PIDConstants(1.5427, 0.0, 0.0), new PIDConstants(2.2224, 0.0, 0.0)),
    8. 
          
  8.     PP_CONFIG,
    9. 
          
  9.     () -> DriverStation.getAlliance().orElse(Alliance.Blue) == Alliance.Red,
    10. 
          
  10.     this);
    11. 
          
  11. Pathfinding.setPathfinder(new LocalADStarAK());
    12. 
          
  12. PathPlannerLogging.setLogActivePathCallback(
    13. 
          
  13.     (activePath) -> {
    14. 
          
  14.       Logger.recordOutput(
    15. 
          
  15.           "Odometry/Trajectory", activePath.toArray(new Pose2d[activePath.size()]));
    16. 
          
  16.     });
    17. 
          
  17. PathPlannerLogging.setLogTargetPoseCallback(
    18. 
          
  18.     (targetPose) -> {
    19. 
          
  19.       Logger.recordOutput("Odometry/TrajectorySetpoint", targetPose);
    20. 
          
  20.     });
    21. 
          
  21.

Docs:
https://pathplanner.dev/pplib-pathfinding.html#advantagekit-compatibility

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2025-02-28T02:51:34.422Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":54,"readers_count":53,"score":20.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":493553,"topic_slug":"swerve-pathfind-to-pose","display_username":"Rishi Desai","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57090,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Head Programming for 7451"},"post_url":"/t/swerve-pathfind-to-pose/493553/5","custom_user_title":"Head Programming for 7451","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3543563,"name":"Rishi Desai","username":"rdesai14","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/3ab097/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-28T16:31:18.295Z","cooked":"

We figured it out. Essentially when we tuned our slip current for our chassis, we made it 60 amps. I think there is an issue in pathplanner’s math because 60 amps would move the robot in teleop using joysticks it was just during auto and path generation. We bumped it up to 100 and it works but

Might be something @mjansen4857 should take a look into
